intro: Ferula erubescens, commonly known as the red ferula, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a panicle, which bloom in the summer months. Its most notable feature is the large, bulbous root, which is thick and fleshy, often used in traditional medicine. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant properties.
